sentence.Network_en: I've placed an asterisk next to the tasks I want you to do first.
sentence.Network_cn: 我在要你首先完成的任务旁边标上了星号。

sentence.Network_en: Items marked with an asterisk can be omitted.
sentence.Network_cn: 打星号的项目可以删去。

sentence.Network_en: The asterisk refers the reader to a footnote.
sentence.Network_cn: 星号是让读者参看脚注.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : via late Latin from Greek asteriskos 'small star', diminutive of astēr

encyclopedia.content: 距离-向量路由协议使用度量来记录路由器与所有知道的目的地之间的距离。这个距离信息使路由器能识别至中某个目的地的最有效下一跳。

entry.tran: 星号（即*，尤用于表示文中另外一处有更多信息）
entry.def: An asterisk is the sign *. It is used especially to indicate that there is further information about something in another part of the text.

means.word_mean: 1. a star-shaped character * used in printing
